triageFlags.title: Loan-to-Value Ratio Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The calculated Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio is within acceptable limits for Tier A.
triageFlags.recommendation: Proceed with the application as the LTV ratio complies with policy.
triageFlags.reasoning: The LTV ratio is calculated as (Advance / Trade Price) * 100. For this application, the LTV is (41000 / 45000) * 100 = 91.11%, which is below the maximum allowable limit of 100% for Tier A applicants.

triageFlags.title: Loan-to-Value exceeds policy limit
triageFlags.description: The Loan-to-Value ratio exceeds the maximum allowed for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider reducing the loan amount or increasing the deposit to meet the LTV requirement.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum LTV of 90% for Tier A applicants. The current LTV is calculated as (Advance / Trade Price) * 100 = (41000 / 45000) * 100 = 91.11%, which exceeds the limit.

triageFlags.title: Debt-to-Income ratio exceeds policy limit
triageFlags.description: The Debt-to-Income ratio exceeds the maximum allowed for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider reducing the loan amount or monthly instalment to meet the DTI requirement.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum DTI of 40% for Tier A applicants. The current DTI is calculated as (Total Monthly Credit Commitments + Proposed Monthly Instalment) / Verified Net Monthly Income = (400 + 850) / 4000 = 41.25%, which exceeds the limit.

content.reasoning: The proposal was evaluated against the underwriting policy, and two medium-severity issues were identified. The Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio exceeds the maximum allowed for the applicant's credit tier, and the Debt-to-Income (DTI) ratio also surpasses the policy limit for the same tier. These findings suggest that the financial structure of the loan may pose a moderate risk.
